skill.name: when-mapping-dependencies-use-dependency-mapper
skill.description: Comprehensive dependency mapping, analysis, and visualization tool for software projects
skill.summary: Comprehensive dependency mapping, analysis, and visualization tool for software projects
skill.author: Claude Code

security_audit.summary: Low-risk analysis tool. Contains bash script wrapper and documentation for dependency mapping. Legitimate network access to known vulnerability databases for security scanning. No malicious patterns detected. Files are primarily documentation and configuration with pseudocode examples.

content.value_statement: Software projects accumulate many dependencies that create security risks and maintenance challenges. This skill extracts, analyzes, and visualizes complete dependency trees across all major package managers. It identifies circular dependencies, outdated packages, and security vulnerabilities with actionable recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Extract dependency trees from npm, pip, cargo, maven, go, and other package managers
Detect circular dependencies and duplicate packages in the dependency graph
Scan for security vulnerabilities using npm audit, Snyk, GitHub, and OSV databases
Identify outdated packages and suggest updates with breaking change warnings
Generate interactive HTML visualizations and SVG diagrams of dependency relationships
Check license compliance and assess supply chain risk for all dependencies
limitations: Requires lock files for accurate dependency resolution (package-lock.json, yarn.lock, etc.)
Security scans require internet access to query vulnerability databases
GraphViz installation needed for SVG export (optional, HTML visualization works without it)
Very large dependency trees may require depth limiting to avoid performance issues

use_cases.title: Pre-release security audit
use_cases.description: Scan all dependencies for critical and high-severity vulnerabilities before production deployment

use_cases.title: CI/CD integration
use_cases.description: Automate dependency analysis in pipelines with exit codes for pass/fail vulnerability thresholds

use_cases.title: Bundle optimization
use_cases.description: Identify duplicate dependencies and heavy packages that can be replaced with lighter alternatives

prompt_templates.title: Basic analysis

prompt_templates.title: Security focus

prompt_templates.title: Circular detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Detect circular dependencies in ./[project-path] and show me the dependency chains that form cycles

prompt_templates.title: Full report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a full dependency analysis report for ./[project-path] including security scan, circular detection, outdated packages, and HTML visualization

output_examples.input: Analyze dependencies in my project with security audit
output: Top Recommendations: Update lodash (CVE-2021-23337), Update axios, Consider replacing moment with date-fns

best_practices: Run dependency analysis before every major release to catch new vulnerabilities
Set up automated security scans in CI/CD with fail-on-high-severity rules
Use the HTML visualization to explore large dependency graphs and identify consolidation opportunities
anti_patterns: Ignoring low-severity vulnerabilities -- they can escalate or be exploited in combination
Adding dependencies without reviewing their dependency trees and transitive dependencies
Skipping lock files in version control -- they are required for accurate vulnerability scanning

faq.question: Which package managers are supported?
faq.answer: npm, yarn, pnpm (JavaScript), pip, poetry, pipenv (Python), cargo (Rust), maven, gradle (Java), go modules, bundler (Ruby), composer (PHP), and nuget (C#).

faq.question: What are the limits for large projects?
faq.answer: Maximum dependency tree depth is 50 levels. Visualization node limit is 1,000 nodes. Large projects benefit from using --max-depth to limit analysis scope.

faq.question: How does it integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Use exit codes: 0 = no critical issues, 1 = critical vulnerabilities found, 2 = analysis failed. Generate JSON reports for automated processing in GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, and other platforms.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Only vulnerability database queries are sent to npm, Snyk, GitHub Security Advisories, and OSV. No project code or dependency lists are stored externally. Results are cached locally only.

faq.question: Why are no dependencies found?
faq.answer: Ensure lock files are present (package-lock.json, yarn.lock, requirements.lock, etc.). Manifest-only analysis provides incomplete results without resolved versions from lock files.

faq.question: How is this different from npm audit?
faq.answer: This tool scans multiple package managers, detects circular dependencies, identifies duplicates, checks outdated packages, generates visualizations, and provides a unified report format across all languages.
